episode: I have been having trouble getting my medicine.

dialogue.speaker: Human
dialogue.message: I've very stressed an anxious right now. I have been trying to get my new medicine since last Thursday to no avail.

dialogue.speaker: Bot
dialogue.message: That sounds really frustrating. What's going on with the medicine?

dialogue.speaker: Human
dialogue.message: My doctor prescribed me a new medicine for anxiety but when I went to the pharmacy they didn't have it in the computer. I have tried three times since Friday and even called the doctor again yesterday. The doctor didn't call me back after several hours so I called him back and he said it was at the pharmacy so now I have to wait for them to open and pray.

dialogue.speaker: Bot
dialogue.message: That's infuriating. I hope the pharmacy has it today and you can finally get the help you need.

dialogue.speaker: Human
dialogue.message: This is so not helping my anxiety problems, you know

dialogue.speaker: Bot
dialogue.message: I can imagine. It's like a vicious cycle, isn't it?

dialogue.speaker: Human
dialogue.message: yep. The worse thing is I don't drive so I put it at the Walgreens down the street that I can walk to but get this- the pharmacy isn't open on weekends. Wasn't Walgreens originally primarily a pharmacy?

dialogue.speaker: Bot
dialogue.message: That's ridiculous. You'd think a pharmacy would be open when people need it most.

dialogue.speaker: Human
dialogue.message: Yeah. I miss the days before the pandemic when Walgreens and Kroger pharmacies were both open 24 hours.

dialogue.speaker: Bot
dialogue.message: Me too, it's like they've forgotten about people's needs.

dialogue.speaker: Human
dialogue.message: Seriously.

dialogue.speaker: Bot
dialogue.message: It's just adding to your stress, isn't it?

dialogue.speaker: Human
dialogue.message: Very much so. I had originally planned on visiting my mother in Delaware for her birthday yesterday but that can't happen until I get my meds and make sure that I don't have any bad side effects.

dialogue.speaker: Bot
dialogue.message: That's a bummer. Missing your mom's birthday must be really disappointing.

dialogue.speaker: Human
dialogue.message: It is. At least her gift got there a couple of days early.

dialogue.speaker: Bot
dialogue.message: That's a small consolation, at least.

dialogue.speaker: Human
dialogue.message: I really hate taking medicines. I'm always worried that they will cause something more severe than my current problem.

dialogue.speaker: Bot
dialogue.message: That's a valid fear. Side effects can be scary.

dialogue.speaker: Human
dialogue.message: Yeah. A lot of them sometimes cause things that can't be seen for 10 to 20 years

dialogue.speaker: Bot
dialogue.message: Long-term effects can be unsettling to think about.
